content: Stores are classes that are instantiated per request or client session. This ensures that the stores are isolated and do not bleed information between requests.
Stores can provide `dehydrate` and `rehydrate` methods so that you can propagate the initial server state to the client.
Stateless async actions Actions are stateless functions that can handle promises or callbacks.
Higher order components Intuitive way to access state from stores or set component child context.
Pluggable Want to add your own interfaces to the Flux flow? Plugins allow you to add methods to any of the contexts.
Updated for React 0.13 Updated to follow React 0.13's changes and the deprecations coming in the next version of React.
